definition: as cold as ice and frost (idiom, usually of woman); icy manner/frigid
ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine
frost/white powder or cream spread over a surface/frosting/(skin) cream

sentences.english: Like young Long female although appearance if angel, actually icedcold sweetheart.
sentences.chinese: 像小龍女般雖然貌若天仙，卻冷若冰霜的情人。

sentences.english: Sven denied he was an "ice man".
sentences.chinese: 埃裏克森否認自己是一個“冷若冰霜的男人”。

sentences.english: To be received in your frozen manner is heart-rending.
sentences.chinese: 受到你那冷若冰霜的接待，我的心都裂開來了。

sentences.english: We may be frozen emotionally, unable to respond.
sentences.chinese: 我們也許是冷若冰霜而無法作出反應。

sentences.english: Teachers should not treat their pupils coldly.
sentences.chinese: 教師對待學生不應該冷若冰霜。

sentences.english: Her indifference aroused perhaps his combative soul.
sentences.chinese: 她的冷若冰霜也許激起了他好勝的靈魂。

sentences.english: Let your handshake be firm, not fishy.
sentences.chinese: 同別人握手要顯得親切，不要冷若冰霜。

sentences.english: Shop ssistants in some state-run shops are frosty in manner, repelling customers from a distance.
sentences.chinese: 有些國營商店的營業員態度冷若冰霜，拒人千里之外。

sentences.english: Catherine had been ice up to this moment .
sentences.chinese: 凱瑟琳至此可說是冷若冰霜。

definition: cold and detached towards sb/lack of regard/indifference/neglect
tender and soft as water/deeply attached to sb
cultured and refined (idiom); gentle and cultivated
